Resources for
lgbtq+ Mental Health

This content is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the advice of a qualified medical professional with any questions you have regarding a medical condition.

Trans Ally Guide

The Trevor Project is an organization dedicated to the prevention of suicide for LGBTQ+ youth. They have produced a guide on how to be an ally to transgender and nonbinary youth.

Bio Pronouns

Article detailing why everyone, including cisgender people, should include their preferred pronouns in their social media bios.

Bi Ally Guide

Biphobia is a huge issue, even in the LGBTQ+ communtiy. This guide to supporting Bi Youth by the Trevor Project details how to be be an ally to bisexual youth.

Supporting Friends

If your friend or family member may be suffering from mental illness, and you're unsure of how you can help, this post from Here to Help BC offers advice and many resources.

Hotlines

If you are in an unsafe setting call 911.

Help Now

The Trevor Project offers a hotline, online chat, and texting for immediate support for those thinking about suicide. Visit the website below for information.
